title: Animals: ways they eat
creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and William A. Anderson
brief_description: Shows how the body parts of various animals are related to their eating habits. Includes such examples as the cirri or barnacles, the mouth parts and legs of crayfish, the teeth of lions and cows, the tongues of butterflies, the noses of hogs, the beaks of birds, and the paws of squirrels.
